pageContext.claim: “Half a million [manufacturing] jobs and that number is going up to about 618,000 jobs very soon.”
pageContext.analysis: As usual, Trump inflates the number of jobs created by counting from Election Day. There have actually been about 450,000 manufacturing jobs created since he took the oath of office. There has been steady growth in jobs since the Great Recession, though manufacturing job growth had stalled in the year before Trump's election.
